metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11222 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
gf_bin128_parse in utils/os_divers.c in GPAC 0.7.1 has a buffer overflowissue for the crypt feature when encountering a crafted_drm_file.xml file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpac - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-5
gpac-modules-base - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-5
libgpac10 - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gpac package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-5').
